greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Goedel encoding of the prime factors of n, in increasing order and repeated according to multiplicity.
comment: For irregular triangle T(n,k) at A027746, a(n) = Product_{1..A001222(n)} pi(k)^T(n,k). - _Michael De Vlieger_, May 04 2020.
reference: K. Gödel, "On Formally Undecidable Propositions of Principia Mathematica and Related Systems", Dover Publications, 1992.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..3322
formula: a(n) = prime(1)^p_1 * prime(2)^p_2 * ... * prime(k)^p_k, where p_1 <= ... <= p_k are the prime factors of n, repeated according to multiplicity.
example: The prime factors of 12 in increasing order and repeated according to multiplicity are 2, 2, 3. Hence a(12) = 2^2 * 3^2 * 5^3 = 4500.
mathematica: Array[Times @@ MapIndexed[Prime[First[#2]]^#1 &, Apply[Join, ConstantArray[#1, #2] & @@@ FactorInteger[#]]] &, 34, 2] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 04 2020 *)
results.author: _Joseph L. Pe_, Sep 28 2002
